intro: Swida poliophylla, commonly known as the whiteleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually pale green to white in color. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. Swida poliophylla is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
